intro: Lappula subsemiglabra, commonly known as the smooth lappula, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered with fine, short hairs. The leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in loose inflorescences, while the fruit is a slender, beak-like capsule containing numerous seeds. This plant thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas.
